column4: You said that there was all the Debian packages plus more, but I cant find the package "mc". Why?
because you have not enabled universe yet
How do I do that?
Adding Repositories: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/AddingRepositoriesHowto
For a ready-to-use sources.list with all official Ubuntu repositories, go to paste.ubuntulinux.nl/38
okay
I cant use the guide you gave a link to - Iam using kubuntu..
have you ever edited /etc/apt/sources.list before?
yes, on my server with "real" Linux Debian
but not on the ubuntu machine?
no
ok, then just do: sudo wget http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/?download=38 -O /etc/apt/sources.list
paste your xorg.conf on the pastebin, I'll have a look
how can I copy ALL the text from xorg.conf to the pastebin homepage?
wget http://ubuntulinux.nl/files/pastebin && cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | python pastebin
http://pastebin.ubuntulinux.nl/877
that xorg.conf looks fine, which setting does it forget?

the setting with the hz - I chosse 1024x768@75hz in dpkg-reconfigure, and then I start my computer up again (I restart) it has forgotten the setting - I can see it is only 1024x768@60hz I right click on the desktop and choose "Indstil desktop"(I dont know what it is call in english - Iam danish)
by the way...I know my screen can run 1024x768@85hz because I have Windows XP and it ran with that resoultion and hz..
do you run kubuntu or ubuntu?
, kubuntu
